Package org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration

Class CartesianLinearAxis

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration.ChartContainer
      • org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration.ConfigurationContainer<ExtendedScale>
        • org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration.Axis
          • org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration.CartesianAxis<CartesianLinearTick>
            • org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration.CartesianLinearAxis
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasBeginAtZeroCallbackHandler, HasMinMaxCallbacksHandler<Double>, IsLinearAxis, IsNumericAxis
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ColorAxis, SizeAxis
    public class CartesianLinearAxis
extends CartesianAxis<CartesianLinearTick>
implements IsLinearAxis
    This object is used to map defined axis as linear.
    Author:
    Andrea "Stock" Stocchero

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Axis getAxisElement()
      Returns the axis instance.
      BegiAtZeroCallbackHandler getBegiAtZeroCallbackHandler()
      Returns a BegiAtZeroCallbackHandler which is managing beginAtZero callback options.
      int getGrace()
      Returns the value in pixels is added to the maximum data value and subtracted from the minimum data.
      This extends the scale range as if the data values were that much greater.
      double getGraceAsPercentage()
      Returns the value in percentage, value between 0 and 1, is added to the maximum data value and subtracted from the minimum data.
      This extends the scale range as if the data values were that much greater.
      GraceCallback getGraceCallback()
      Returns the user callback that sets the value in pixels is added to the maximum data value and subtracted from the minimum data.
      MinMaxCallbacksHandler<Double> getMinMaxCallbacksHandler()
      Returns a MinMaxCallbacksHandler which is managing all min and max callbacks options.
      CartesianLinearTick getTicks()
      Returns the ticks element
      private Object onGrace​(ScaleContext context, int defaultValue)
      Returns an object as string when the callback has been activated.
      void setGrace​(int grace)
      Sets the value in pixels is added to the maximum data value and subtracted from the minimum data.
      This extends the scale range as if the data values were that much greater.
      void setGrace​(GraceCallback graceCallback)
      Sets the user callback that sets the value in pixels is added to the maximum data value and subtracted from the minimum data.
      void setGrace​(NativeCallback graceCallback)
      Sets the user callback that sets the value in pixels is added to the maximum data value and subtracted from the minimum data.
      void setGraceAsPercentage​(double grace)
      Sets the value in percentage, value between 0 and 1, is added to the maximum data value and subtracted from the minimum data.
      This extends the scale range as if the data values were that much greater.

      • setGrace

        public void setGrace​(int grace)
        Sets the value in pixels is added to the maximum data value and subtracted from the minimum data.
        This extends the scale range as if the data values were that much greater.
        Parameters:
        grace - the value in pixels is added to the maximum data value and subtracted from the minimum data

      • getGrace

        public int getGrace()
        Returns the value in pixels is added to the maximum data value and subtracted from the minimum data.
        This extends the scale range as if the data values were that much greater.
        Returns:
        the value in pixels is added to the maximum data value and subtracted from the minimum data

        Returns an object as string when the callback has been activated.
